page.title: 03MARINE LIFE IN LERRYN RIVER
page.content: Several species of fish are found in the river. {Sea-trout}and{salmon}are indigenous to the river and spawn in it's upper reaches. However to help maintain the stocks of these fish, especially the salmon, the{South {West Water Authority}operate a fish breeding programme in the river where it runs through the Boconnoc Estate. The fish are{stunned}and the eggs and sperm removed and artificially fertilized. In this way thousands of embryos are produced and put in{hatcheries.}When the{fry}are large enough to give them a good chance of survival, they are released into the{river}from where they{migrate to their feeding grounds in the open sea. Ultimatelty some of the mature fish will return to the river to {spawn.
